request.description: Block a user based on his id.
Unblock a user based on his id

Change the status of a specific transfer request to "REQUIRES_CHANGE" and set the requires change note.

The transferRequestId is the public id.

Change the status of a transfer request back to SUBMITTED.

The transferRequestId is the public id.

Reject a transfer request and set the rejection note.

The transferRequestId is the public id.

Approve a transfer request.

The transferRequestId is the public id.

Approve a list of transfer requests.

Use a list of the transfer request public id.

Reject a list of transfer requests and set the same rejection note for all.

Use a list of the transfer request public id.
Delete a draft transfer request based on the transfer request public id.

Upload a CSV file with a transfer request to be created.

Pass the programId that the transfer requests will be created.

body.raw:
{
    "requests": [
        {
            "amount": "1",
            "receiverEmail": "user14@email.com",
            "team": "Test No New New",
            "wallet": "",
            "programId": 5,
            "currencyUnitId": 1,
            "shouldReceiverReview": false,
            "row": 2
        },
        {
            "amount": "1",
            "receiverEmail": "user14@email.com",
            "team": "Test Yes New New",
            "wallet": "",
            "programId": 5,
            "currencyUnitId": 1,
            "shouldReceiverReview": true,
            "row": 3
        }
    ]
}

request.description:
Submit a list of transfer requests to be created after uploading a CSV.

Pass the CSV fields to create the transfer request:

amount: The amount requested in FIL

receiverEmail: The receiver's email

team: The team name

wallet: The wallet address

programId: The program Id

currencyUnitId: The currency unit (1 = FIL , 2 = USD)

shouldReceiverReview: Create as a draft or not

row: row in the CSV file

Create a list of transfer requests for users different than the requester.

Pass the transfer request fields.

Pass the CSV fields to create the transfer request:

shouldReceiverReview: Create as a draft or not

programId: The program Id

receiverEmail: The receiver's email

team: The team name

amount: The amount requested in FIL

currencyUnitId: The currency unit (1 = FIL , 2 = USD)

wallet: The wallet address

List the transfer requests based on the filters.

The filter could contain:

status= The status of the transfer request

programId= A list of programs

number= A specific number for the transfer request

team= A list of teams

from= Start time frame

to = End time frame

wallet= A specific wallet

size= The number of transfer request per page

page= The page
Delete a transfer request based on the transfer request public id.
Reject a list of tax form files based on the ids and set a reason for all rejections.
Approve a list of tax form files based on the ids.

List the transfer requests based on the filters.

The filter could contain:

status= The status of the transfer request

programId= A list of programs

number= A specific number for the transfer request

team= A list of teams

from= Start time frame

to = End time frame

wallet= A specific wallet

size= The number of transfer request per page

page= The page

Reject a transfer request and set the rejection note.

The transferRequestId is the public id.

Prepare a list of transfer requests to be paid  
  
Pass a list of transfer request id.

Cancel a list of transfer requests to be paid if something goes wrong during the contract forward method  
  
Pass a list of transfer request id.

Update a list of transfer requests setting the hash of the transaction after the forward.  
  
Pass a list of transfer request id and the transaction hash.

item.name: Token price

request.description: Refresh the token price.

Update the token price.

Pass the price and the token name.

item.description: Users with the SUPER and CONTROLLER could perform these actions.

request.description:
Invite a user for the application.

Pass the user email.

Ban a user from the application based on his id.

Pass the ban reason.
Unban a user from the application based on his id.

Create a new program.

Pass the program fields:  

name: Program name

paymentMethod: Methods for payment request in fil and pay in fil - 1 / request in usd and pay in fil 2

deliverMethod: Methods for the deliver ONE_TIME or MULTISIG_1_OF_2

approversRole: The role information

viewersRole: The role information

programCurrency: The name could be FIL or USD

visibility: The program visibility could be INTERNAL or EXTERNAL

signerWalletAddresses: The wallet addresses when multisig

item.name: Get associated requests with a program

Pass the program fields:

name: Program name

paymentMethod: Methods for payment request in fil and pay in fil - 1 / request in usd and pay in fil 2

deliverMethod: Methods for the deliver ONE_TIME or MULTISIG_1_OF_2

approversRole: The role information

viewersRole: The role information

programCurrency: The name could be FIL or USD

visibility: The program visibility could be INTERNAL or EXTERNAL

signerWalletAddresses: The wallet addresses when multisig
Log out from the account.

Log in to the application.

Pass the email and password.

**PUBLIC**

Verify the login code.

Pass the code and the jwt token.

SIgn up into the application.

Pass the email, password, and the password confirmation.

**PUBLIC**

Log in with Google.

Pass the authorization code.

**PUBLIC**
Get the current token price.
Get the logged-in user information.

Send the notification to change the password.

Pass the user email.

**PUBLIC**

Re-send the login code.

Pass the JWT token.

Send an email notification to activate the account.

Pass the user email.

**PUBLIC**

Reset the users password.

Pass the:

password: The user password.

passwordConfirm: The password confirmation.

token: JWT token.

**PUBLIC**

Upload the tax form file.

Pass the tax file and the type that could be W9_FORM or W8_FORM.
Visualize the tax form file based on its public id.

Update the user tax form file.

Pass the:

isUSResident: Boolean, true or false.

userFileId: Public file id.
Delete a tax form file based on its public id.
Modal to send fill

Send an X amount to verify the user's wallet.

Pass the wallet address and the blockchain.

Verify a wallet based on the verification id.

Pass the:

amount: Amount of fil send on the verification amount request.

unit: Amount unit.

name: Wallet alias.

Skip the wallet verification.

Pass the:

blockchain: Wallet chain.

address: Wallet address.

name: Wallet label.

skipAlert: Email to verify.

isDefault: Set default wallet.

Connect an Ethereum wallet address.

Pass the:

walletAddress: Ethereum wallet address.

label: Wallet label.
Delete a wallet based on its id.

Set the default wallet.

Pass the wallet id.

Save the user's personal information.

Pass the:

countryResidence: The name of the country.

dateOfBirth: The specific date.

lastName: The user's last name.

firstName: The user's first name.

body.raw:
{
    "pii": {
        "countryResidence": "USA",
        "dateOfBirth": "1995-01-01T02:00:00.000Z",
        "lastName": "10",
        "firstName": "Testing"
    },
    "terms": {
        "informedDecision": true,
        "release": true,
        "satisfactionOfObligations": true,
        "soleControl": true,
        "tax": true,
        "transferAuthorization": true,
        "sanctions": true,
        "walletAddress": true,
        "informedDecisionText": "You represent that you have acquired sufficient information about crypto assets or tokens and wallet technology to reach an informed and knowledgeable decision regarding receipt of crypto assets or tokens.",
        "releaseText": "In exchange for good and valuable consideration, the sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, you hereby agree to release and forever discharge the Company, its officers, directors, employees and other personnel, shareholders and agents, and their respective affiliates (collectively, the \"Released Parties\") from all causes of action, expenses (including attorneys' fees and costs), damages, judgments, claims and demands whatsoever, whether known or unknown, now accrued or hereafter accruing, in law or equity, against any Released Party which you ever had, now have, or may in the future have for any claim arising out of the timing of the Company's distribution of crypto assets or tokens to you via the Coin Emissary tool (“Emissary”). The Company shall work in good faith to distribute crypto assets or tokens owed to you in a timely manner.",
        "satisfactionOfObligationsText": "You acknowledge that, upon delivery of the crypto assets or tokens to the wallet address you are providing, such crypto assets or tokens will be deemed to be delivered in full, and the obligations of the Company to deliver such crypto assets or tokens to you will be deemed satisfied.",
        "soleControlText": "You understand and agree that, once tokens have been transferred to the provided address, the crypto asset or tokens are in your sole control. You agree that Protocol Labs will not be responsible for any loss or theft of such tokens after they have been transferred.You represent that the crypto address you are providing is correct. You are acknowledging that providing an incorrect wallet address could result in unrecoverable loss of some or all of the Crypto assets or tokens that Protocol Labs is transferring to you, and that Protocol Labs and affiliated entities will not be liable in the event you provide an inaccurate wallet address.",
        "taxText": "You acknowledge that transferring tokens to your wallet, and your use of those crypto assets or tokens, may have significant tax consequences and that you are solely responsible for any taxes due as a result of the transfer. You further acknowledge that Protocol Labs cannot provide you with tax advice, and recognize that it is your obligation, if you so desire, to seek independent counsel to determine the full extent of your tax liability under applicable laws and regulations. You further acknowledge and agree that Protocol Labs shall be entitled to withhold taxes on any transfer, as required by law, in Protocol Labs' sole discretion.",
        "transferAuthorizationText": "You authorize Protocol Labs to transfer any and all tokens owed to you to the address you are providing, or to one or more wallets controlled by it. You represent that you own and control the address you are providing.",
        "sanctionsText": "You represent that you (or the entity you represent) are not 50% or more owned or controlled by an individual or entity that is the target of sanctions administered by the Office of Foreign Assets Control of the United States Treasury Department, the United States Department of State, the United Nations Security Council, the European Union, or Her Majesty’s Treasury (collectively, “Sanctions”). You represent and warrant that your conduct related to the payment(s) made via Emissary is in compliance with applicable Sanctions in all material respects.",
        "walletAddressText": "You represent that the crypto address you are providing is correct. You are acknowledging that providing an incorrect wallet address could result in unrecoverable loss of some or all of the Crypto assets or tokens that Protocol Labs is transferring to you, and that Protocol Labs and affiliated entities will not be liable in the event you provide an inaccurate wallet address."
    },
    "taxForm": {
        "isUSResident": true,
        "userFileId": "clhyxxbd9000hc9nm4jl9g480"
    },
    "isOnboarded": true
}
